name: White Wine Skillet Chicken and Potatoes
description: A one-pan meal with chicken, potatoes, carrots, herbs, and a creamy wine sauce. Adapted from Gathered Nutrition.
gist: Chicken, mirepoix and potatoes, herbs, wine, stock, simmer, cream, spinach.
ingredients:
Chicken (preferably thighs)
1/4–1/2 white onion
Potatoes (baby potatoes halved or yellow potatoes chopped large)
Carrots (equal amount to potatoes, chopped large)
Garlic
Herbs
1/2 cup white wine
1/2 cup chicken stock
Heavy cream
Cornstarch slurry
Optional: spinach and/or lemon wedge
steps:
1. Chop chicken into bite-size pieces. Skip salting as the stock and seasonings provide flavor.
2. Sear chicken in a large pan for browning, then remove.
3. Add onion, potatoes, carrots, garlic, salt, and pepper; cook until onions are translucent and vegetables start to brown.
4. Deglaze pan with white wine.
5. Increase heat and reduce wine to 1/3, scraping brown bits.
6. Add herbs, chicken, and chicken stock; ensure enough liquid to cook vegetables but not too much to create soup.
7. Cover and simmer 15 minutes, checking every 5 minutes for doneness.
8. Once cooked, add a splash of cream and a handful of spinach. For thicker sauce, add 1–2 tbsp cornstarch slurry and cook 1–2 more minutes.
9. Optionally garnish with a lemon wedge.
